intro: Test your knowledge of this week's Herald news!

questions.question: What day will Josiah’s begin offering milkshakes?
questions.explanation: After months of anticipation, Josiah’s will officially begin churning out milkshakes on April 2, marking the end of a year-long initiative by the Undergraduate Council of Students.

questions.question: Who did the women’s rugby team defeat in the tournament finale this weekend?
questions.explanation: After going undefeated in regular play — taking down the Hawks 24-22, the Maddogs 39-0 and the Eagles 50-0 — Brown defeated Northeastern 41-7 in the tournament finale.

questions.question: What newspaper did Carol Agate ’55 write for?
questions.explanation: Agate, who studied physics, said she was “very active” as a writer for the Pembroke Record, the college’s student newspaper.

questions.question: What was the theme of The Met’s brunch this past weekend?
questions.explanation: This past weekend, students eating at the Rhode Island School of Design’s the Met dining hall were treated to more than just food. The dining hall’s Japanese-themed brunch featured a variety of Japanese dishes and a performance from Japanese drumming group Gendo Taiko.

questions.question: Who organized the lunch meeting for concerned researchers, faculty and library staff on losing federal data under the Trump administration?
questions.explanation: Last month, Holly Case, a professor of history and the deputy director of the Data Science Institute, held a lunch meeting convening researchers, faculty members and library staff. A shared concern brought them there: losing federal data under the Trump administration.

questions.question: What percentage of Rhode Islanders received SNAP benefits in 2024?
questions.explanation: 1,800 Rhode Islanders were robbed of over $500,000 in food benefits due to EBT card skimmers, R.I. DHS said.

questions.question: Which artist designed the “Unsui (Cloud Forest)” art exhibition in Sayles Hall?
questions.explanation: Those venturing into Sayles Hall this spring might notice an unusually cloudy ceiling atop the portrait-lined walls. Visitors can now experience the building’s main hall in a new light — literally — thanks to interdisciplinary artist Sanford Biggers’s new installation, “Unsui (Cloud Forest).”

questions.question: What new establishment has repurposed the old Union Station in downtown Providence?
questions.explanation: After years of anticipation, the 18,000-square-foot Track 15 food hall opened inside the former Union Station in downtown Providence on Tuesday.

questions.question: Who directed ‘Novocaine’?
questions.explanation: “Novocaine” follows Nathan Caine (Jack Quaid), an assistant manager of a financial institution with a genetic disorder that makes him unable to feel physical pain. It’s the kind of gimmick that could be exhausting and flat — think the endless bee jokes in “The Beekeeper” — but writer Lars Jacobson and directors Dan Berk and Robert Olsen make it work.

questions.question: What was the first class to have need-blind admissions for domestic applicants?
questions.explanation: Brown implemented need-blind admissions for domestic applicants starting with the class of 2007.
